dataset.title: Interaction of waves with idealized high-relief bottom roughness, model parameters and code

creator.organizationName: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

abstract.para: Interactions between waves and large bottom roughness were investigated using Large Eddy Simulations of oscillatory flow over infinite hemisphere arrays. Simulations were made using the open source computational fluid dynamics code OpenFOAM. Wave amplitude, period, and hemisphere spacing were varied to investigate the dependence of kinematics and dynamics on dimensionless parameters, including the Keulegan-Carpenter number (KC), the ratio of wave orbital excursion to roughness element size. This archive includes the input files and user written routines to reproduce the simulations in the paper.
Yu, X., J. H. Rosman, and J. L. Hench, 2018. Interaction of waves with idealized high-relief bottom roughness, Journal of Geophysical Research (Oceans), doi:10.1002/2017JC013515.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Idealized modeling study of wave-driven flow over high relief topography

description.para: Simulations were conducted using the open source computational fluid dynamics software OpenFOAM 3.0.0. The original source code for the OpenFOAM model is archived at https://openfoam.org/version/3-0-0/. Source code required to generate the computation grids used in the paper, and the input files needed to reproduce the model runs in paper are archived here.

project.title: Collaborative Research: Relating topographic complexity and circulation patterns on coral reefs from colony-scale to reef-scale

relatedProject.title: Collaborative Research: Relating topographic complexity and circulation patterns on coral reefs from colony-scale to reef-scale
